sentence.Network_en: There are other forms of civil disorder — most notably, football hooliganism.
sentence.Network_cn: 还有其他形式的民众骚乱，最出名的是足球流氓行为。

sentence.Network_en: This show has several strengths — notably a strong cast.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个表演有一些亮点——尤其是演员阵容特别强大。

sentence.Network_en: The house had many drawbacks, most notably its price.
sentence.Network_cn: 这房子有很多缺陷，尤其是它的价格。

list.abs: 他们在1974年生产塑料产品（notably connectors），于1991年在台湾证券交易所上市。其后到香港挂牌，更成为恒生指数成份股之一。
现在我们回到讨论人的正题来，之前说了教研人员，接下来说说杰出校友（notable alumni）。有一种观点认为，一所大学历史越长， …
...出对肿瘤患者产生显著影响的研究结果，列为值得关注的主要进展（Notable Advances）。
什么意思_英语notable在线翻译_有道词典... ... note 注意；记录；注解 Notable Book 将其列入优秀读物 Most Notable 最值得一提.

entry.def: You use notably to specify an important or typical example of something that you are talking about.

example.ex: The divorce would be granted when more important problems, notably the fate of the children, had been decided...
example.tran: 更为重要的问题，尤其是孩子的问题得到解决后，离婚会获批准。

example.ex: It was a question of making sure certain needs were addressed, notably in the pensions area.
example.tran: 问题是确保满足某些需求，尤其是养老金这块儿。

entry.def: You can use notably to emphasize a particular quality that someone or something has.

example.ex: Old established friends are notably absent, so it's a good opportunity to make new contacts...
example.tran: 老朋友们统统都没有来，因此这是个结交新朋友的好机会。

example.ex: A notably short, silver-haired man, he plays basketball with his staff several times a week.
example.tran: 他个子明显较为矮小，一头银发，每周都会和他的员工一起打几次篮球。

sentences.sentence: "notably in the social sciences, the professors teach too much"

sentences.en: Many students were absent, notably the monitor.
sentences.cn: 许多学生缺席，特别是连班长也没来。
